items.q: to ____________________ the challenges of the future
to ____________________ in contact with a person
to ____________________ your seatbelt
____________________ a timely fashion
to be aware ____________________ a situation
to appeal ____________________ a certain type of customer
to help ____________________ several ways
to spill sauce ____________________ your shirt
My sister went to the grocery store yesterday to buy some chocolate ____________________ (milk / milks).
The space shuttle Discovery successfully returned to Earth despite a potentially serious and potentially fatal ____________________ (problem / problems) with its foam insulation during takeoff.
When I returned from vacation, my mailbox was filled with ____________________ (bill / bills).
Some ____________________ (diet / diets) allow people to eat small portions of any food they want.
Several years ago, a group of government ____________________ (official / officials) decided to cancel plans to build the important dam.
The ____________________ (pollution / pollutions) in our environment is becoming worse every day.
After the team had met for several hours, they were able to come up with a number of important ____________________ (idea / ideas) for the project.
Our local recycling center accepts newspapers, aluminum ____________________ (can / cans), plastic containers, and glass bottles.
Maya is getting her ____________________ (hair / hairs) cut, and then she will buy some shampoo.
Officials will not comment on the amount of ____________________ (money / moneys) that the thieves were able to steal.
Hint: A topic sentence must be specific. a. It is easy to build a birdhouse if you follow these five steps. b. Birdhouses are nice decorations.

Hint: A topic sentence cannot be a well-known fact. a. You must be 18 years old to vote in the United States. b. The voting age should be lowered to 16 years old in order to get more young adults interested and involved in the political process.
Hint: A topic sentence must be specific, but not too specific. a. The dictionary defines tortellini as a small, ring-shaped type of pasta. b. The most difficult pasta to make at home is tortellini.

Hint: A topic sentence must contain a controlling idea that guides the paragraph. a. Severe allergies can cause problems with a patient's physical and emotional health. b. People can get really sick when they have allergies.
Hint: A topic sentence must be specific. a. Skydiving is very dangerous. b. Skydiving is a dangerous sport for people with health problems.
Hint: Do not put two competing controlling ideas in a topic sentence. a. Lions and panthers have much in common. b. Lions and panthers are similar, but they have a lot of differences, too.

Hint: A topic sentence cannot be a well-known fact. a. International students can experience culture shock when they travel. b. Culture shock can affect how international students relate to native speakers and their culture.
Hint: A topic sentence cannot be a well-known fact. a. There has been controversy about who first invented the telephone. b. The telephone was invented in 1870's.
Hint: A topic sentence cannot be a well-known fact. There needs to be a controlling idea. a. The blue whale is one of the most magnificent creatures on the planet. b. The blue whale is a mammal.
Hint: A topic sentence must be specific. a. Gossip is really bad for the workplace. b. Spreading gossip in the workplace can hurt employee morale and productivity.
Choose the transition that best completes the concluding sentence for Paragraph 1. a. Afterward b. Therefore c. Instead
Identify the function of the concluding sentence for Paragraph 1. a. restates the main idea b. offers a suggestion c. makes a prediction
Choose the transition that best completes the concluding sentence for Paragraph 2. a. Instead b. Even so c. Surely
Identify the function of the concluding sentence for Paragraph 2. a. offers a suggestion b. gives an opinion c. makes a prediction
Choose the transition that best fits the concluding sentence for Paragraph 3. a. Indeed b. Obviously c. In fact
Identify the function of the concluding sentence for Paragraph 3. a. restates the main idea b. offers a suggestion c. gives an opinion
in no time
gigantic
courteous
appropriately
controversy
spare
highlight
stuck
thus
principal
There were more than three hundred doctor at the convention last weekend. ____________________
Dr. Soto gave many reason for the increase in diabetes among children. ____________________
Most of the player on our soccer team are very fast runners. ____________________
Several states have passed laws about smoking in public places. ____________________
Studies show that two-thirds of the womens in California do not use sunscreen. ____________________
Taking proper care of one's health can also lead to a better social life. ____________________
The confidence that a person gains from feeling healthy and in shape improves his or her social and business relationships. ____________________
Also, because health-minded people engage in a variety of physical activities. ____________________
They increase their chances of meeting people. ____________________
For example, making friends at the local gym. ____________________
Similarly, someone who goes to the beach frequently to play volleyball greatly increases his or her chances of meeting new friends. ____________________
Since people who pursue a healthy lifestyle look and feel better about themselves. ____________________
They are more likely to have good social lives. ____________________
And they happier and busier people. ____________________
So, if you want to feel better about yourself, you might consider following a healthy lifestyle. ____________________

Write about your favorite type of movie (action, comedy, romance, science fiction, etc.). Why do you enjoy this type of movie? Include a topic sentence with a controlling idea as well as related supporting sentences.
